newsitem.title: UKRAINE: German Reemstma to boost Ukraine cigarette output.
newsitem.headline: German Reemstma to boost Ukraine cigarette output.

text.p: Germany's Reemstma tobacco firm plans to boost output at its Ukrainian branch to 12-14 billion cigarettes a year in 1997 from 10 billion this year, a top company official said on Thursday.
The three-year-old joint venture is aiming to expand its operation and has contracted a Swiss firm to build a new factory on the edge of Kiev next year at a cost of 25 million marks ($16.5 million).
"Our current factory is in the centre of Kiev, and the building is old and there is no room to expand," general manager Serhy Poliychyk told Reuters.
The company hopes eventually to produce 30-35 billion cigarettes a year, he added.
"It all depends on demand, and on our competition."
Poliychuk said Reemstma-Ukraine faces competition from B.A.T. Industries Plc, Philip Morris Cos Inc and R.J.Reynolds Tobacco Co.
Reemstma this week won a tender in Moldova giving it control of that former Soviet republic's tobacco industry.
Poliychuk said that Ukraine, with 52 million people, is one of the lowest tobacco consumers per head in eastern Europe.

"Hungary, with a population of 10 million people, smokes 24 billion cigarettes a year. Ukraine, during the good times when people could still buy whatever they wanted, bought 72 billion cigarettes a year," he said.
